title: Does spack work on alpine?
body:
I've installed g++, gfortran, and all the build tools I'm able to find for alpine, but I keep getting:

```
2 errors found in build log:
  >> 6    configure: error: in `/tmp/root/spack-stage/spack-stage-_73gNo/pkgconf-1.6.0':
  >> 7    configure: error: C compiler cannot create executables
     8    See `config.log' for more details

See build log for details:
  /home/spack/var/spack/stage/pkgconf-1.6.0-5k3ytveiqoecv6huh6fulebbotrhcgy4/spack-build.out
/ # cat /home/spack/var/spack/stage/pkgconf-1.6.0-5k3ytveiqoecv6huh6fulebbotrhcgy4/spack-build.out
==> Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> Executing phase: 'configure'
==> [2019-05-04-15:47:42.524938] '/home/spack/var/spack/stage/pkgconf-1.6.0-5k3ytveiqoecv6huh6fulebbotrhcgy4/pkgconf-1.6.0/configure' '--prefix=/home/spack/opt/spack/linux-alpine3-x86_64/gcc-8.3.0/pkgconf-1.6.0-5k3ytveiqoecv6huh6fulebbotrhcgy4'

checking whether the C compiler works... no
configure: error: in `/tmp/root/spack-stage/spack-stage-_73gNo/pkgconf-1.6.0':
configure: error: C compiler cannot create executables
See `config.log' for more details
```
Has anyone tried this before? I thought it would be a fairly easy fix, but I'm going around now installing random packages and can't get it working.
